definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: At first glance, it seems like the sort of story that falls in with the rest of the modern genre.
sentences.chinese: 初看來，這部書似乎與當代流派的其他作品類似。

sentences.english: The second and the third chapter discuss the Gongan School .
sentences.chinese: 第二章和第三章是流派論。

sentences.english: There are eight major schools of yoga, each varying in its area of emphasis.
sentences.chinese: 瑜珈有八大流派，每派強調的領域有異。

sentences.english: So there was a huge variety of philosophy in ancient Greece.
sentences.chinese: 古希臘存在着大量的哲學流派。

sentences.english: It is concerned more with verse than prose and represents the Poetics of Gongorism.
sentences.chinese: 它更多關注詩句而非散文，代表了貢戈拉流派的詩學。

sentences.english: That means well-known names and obedience to genre conventions.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着清楚明白的名稱和遵從流派慣例。

sentences.english: Many of you have been asking us about The Estée Lauder Companies Holiday press party this year.
sentences.chinese: 許多人向我們問起今年雅詩蘭黛公司的時尚名流派對。

sentences.english: The exhibits were arranged according to schools.
sentences.chinese: 展品是依照流派陳列的。

sentences.english: Gravure girls appear in a wide range of photography styles and genres.
sentences.chinese: 凹印女孩出現在廣泛的攝影風格和流派。

sentences.english: In the private compilation of the mid and late periods of Ming Dynasty, there appeared two schools of solemnness and wittiness.
sentences.chinese: 明代中後期的私人修史，形成嚴肅與諧趣兩種流派。

sentences.english: At last, the brief introduction for the mainly genres and styles of lion-dance sports is given.
sentences.chinese: 最後簡述了舞獅運動的主要流派和風格。

sentences.english: Some schools of psychotherapy are more appropriate than others.
sentences.chinese: 有些心理治療流派會更爲恰當。

sentences.english: The Chaozhou zither is one of its large genres.
sentences.chinese: 潮州箏就是其中的一大流派。

sentences.english: In the Jin and Yuan Dynasties, there appeared the so-called four great medical schools.
sentences.chinese: 金元時期出現了後世稱爲“金元四大家”的醫學流派。

sentences.english: Before 1900 many variations of jiujitsu were taught.
sentences.chinese: 1900年前，很多流派的柔術在傳授。

sentences.english: The second school holds that ideas are the product of hard work and thoughtful concentration.
sentences.chinese: 另一個流派認爲，想法是辛勤勞動和凝神思考的產物。

definition: great scholar respected for learning and integrity
Zhengtong Emperor, reign name of sixth Ming Emperor Zhu Qizhen 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
to have a style of one's own
representative individual (of a school of thought)
branch (of company, river etc)/to branch/to diverge/to ramify/to subdivide
